Class World

java.lang.Object
  World

public class World
extends java.lang.Object

The World class represents a Level in which the player can explore and interact with.

Author:
Kevin Scroggins

parseFrom

public static World parseFrom(java.lang.String fileName,
                              SpriteSheets spriteSheets)
Parses a World from the specified file and instantiates all of the Entities using their corresponding Sprites found in the collection of SpriteSheets.

Parameters:
fileName - the World file to load.
spriteSheets - the SpriteSheet collection to instantiate the Entity Sprites with.
Returns:
the World parsed from the specified input parameters.

readFrom

public static World readFrom(java.io.BufferedReader in,
                             SpriteSheets spriteSheets)
                      throws java.io.IOException
Parses a World from the specified input stream and instantiates all of the Entities using their corresponding Sprites found in the collection of SpriteSheets.

Parameters:
in - the input stream to parse the World from.
spriteSheets - the SpriteSheet collection to instantiate the Entity Sprites with.
Returns:
the World parsed from the specified input parameters.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if there was an error reading the World from the specified input stream.

writeTo

public void writeTo(java.lang.String fileName)
Outputs the current world to the specified file.

Parameters:
fileName - the file to output the World to.

writeTo

public void writeTo(java.io.PrintWriter out)
             throws java.io.IOException
Outputs the World to the specified output stream.

Parameters:
out - the output stream to Write the World to.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if there was an error writing to the output file.

paintOn

public void paintOn(java.awt.Graphics g,
                    java.awt.Color lineColour,
                    java.awt.Color vertexColour)
Renders the World onto the specified Graphics component. Currently only renders the collision boundaries and not the Entities contained within the World.

Parameters:
g - the Graphics component to render onto.
lineColour - the colour to render the Edges of the Graph.
vertexColour - the colour to render the Vertices of each Edge.
